Leaving the old border behind[edit]

Voting period is over. Please don't add any new votes. Voting period ends on 11 Mar 2018 at 10:15:16 (UTC)

Original – Finnish soldiers crossing the old 1939 border (Treaty of Tartu) during the 1941 offensive phase of the Continuation War against the Soviet Union. The crossing is from Tohmajärvi, Finland, to Pälksaari (now the area of Ozero Pyalk-Yarvi, Russia). Regaining the old border, lost during the Winter War, had been presented by the Finnish government as one of the justifications to launch the war.
Reason
Historic and good quality image illustrates the article and event well
Articles in which this image appears
Continuation War
FP category for this image
Wikipedia:Featured pictures/History/World War II
Creator
Lieutenant Eronen
  • Support as nominator – Manelolo (talk) 10:15, 1 March 2018 (UTC)
  • 2nd iconic candidate pic of Finland in WW2 and by far the best one of any "border crossing" pics from the war. I've tried to make the caption neutral as possible, but this event had profound effects and moral scrutiny attached to it. I believe some authors have called the point of crossing the old, original border turning the war from "national defence and righting the wrongs" to "foreign conquest." Likewise, the Allies pressured Finland to stop their advance after the war became morally more ambiguous. The title of the pic is an amended translation from the original caption "Miehet jättävät rajan taakseen" = "Men leaving the border behind." I've cropped a watermark and scan remnants, but otherwise left it alone. Manelolo (talk) 10:27, 1 March 2018 (UTC)
  • I withdraw my nomination Ack! After further research and verification, this is a pic from the start of the invasion and not the "old border" in fact; the caption left by a former editor on the pic had me fooled. Apologies, will amend text on the file page accordingly and repropose later. Manelolo (talk) 12:06, 1 March 2018 (UTC)

Not Promoted --Manelolo (talk) 13:37, 1 March 2018 (UTC)

  • Self-withdrawn nomination. Manelolo (talk) 13:37, 1 March 2018 (UTC)

  • Support as nominator – Charlesjsharp (talk) 18:36, 20 February 2018 (UTC)

Plain tiger[edit]

Voting period is over. Please don't add any new votes. Voting period ends on 2 Mar 2018 at 18:40:28 (UTC)

Original – Plain tiger butterfly (Danaus chrysippus chrysippus) male from Kerala, India
Reason
High quality image illustrates article well. FP on Commons.
Articles in which this image appears
Plain tiger
FP category for this image
Wikipedia:Featured pictures/Animals/Insects
Creator
Charlesjsharp
  • Support as nominator – Charlesjsharp (talk) 18:40, 20 February 2018 (UTC)
  • Support – Bammesk (talk) 04:04, 23 February 2018 (UTC)
  • I miss some vibrance here, colors are washed. Dont know if will OKed - background. --PetarM (talk) 10:52, 25 February 2018 (UTC)
  • Oppose - Understood that this is a FP on the commons, but the more I look at it and compare it with other FP butterflies, the more it looks like the head and thorax are out of focus. -chsh (talk) 14:56, 25 February 2018 (UTC)

Not Promoted --Armbrust The Homunculus 22:02, 2 March 2018 (UTC)



Ansel Adams[edit]

Voting period is over. Please don't add any new votes. Voting period ends on 4 Mar 2018 at 03:07:19 (UTC)

Original – Portrait of notable United States nature photographer Ansel Adams
Reason
Lead image in the Ansel Adams article; good quality and EV
Articles in which this image appears
Ansel Adams, J. Malcolm Greany, Conservation Photography, Taos art colony
FP category for this image
Wikipedia:Featured pictures/People/Others
Creator
J. Malcolm Greany, with edits by Kaidor and Utzdman55
  • Support as nominator – Pine✉ 03:07, 22 February 2018 (UTC)
  • Support Charlesjsharp (talk) 09:20, 22 February 2018 (UTC)
  • Support Likewise. --Janke | Talk 10:21, 22 February 2018 (UTC)
  • Support f/64? I joke....--LivioAndronico (talk) 19:45, 22 February 2018 (UTC)
  • Comment - bottom right corner needs to be touched up. Also obvious bright spots on his coat and pants can be removed. Bammesk (talk) 03:58, 23 February 2018 (UTC)
  • Agree with Bammesk. If my laptop weren't in the shop, I'd look into doing it myself. Crisco 1492 mobile (talk) 09:21, 23 February 2018 (UTC)
  • I see the crack in the lower right corner, which could be digitally repaired although I think that its small size and its placement makes it be unnecessary to repair unless someone is motivated to do so. I think that the white specks on Ansel's coat are "pills" which should be left alone for historical authenticity, since they are not dust on the photograph. I am less certain about the specks on his pants, but upon close inspection I agree that they are probably imperfections that could be repaied. --Pine✉ 20:28, 26 February 2018 (UTC)
  • Oppose Uncalibrated mastership --PetarM (talk) 10:46, 25 February 2018 (UTC)
  • What does that mean? --Janke | Talk 13:14, 26 February 2018 (UTC)
  • @Janke: In EXIF you can see Color space:Uncalibrated. Resulting "its can be seen with fake colors" on some browsers etc. Normaly should be in RGB space - even BW. --PetarM (talk) 14:05, 1 March 2018 (UTC)
  • If that's your only reason for opposing, I uploaded a new version in RGB, slightly adjusted curve (contrast) and even fixed the crack in the lower right corner... Feel free to revert if you don't like it. --Janke | Talk 19:43, 1 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Support now --PetarM (talk) 10:27, 2 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Support - Iconic. – Juliancolton | Talk 23:47, 26 February 2018 (UTC)
  • Support This is a very clear photo and deserves to be an FP. Goveganplease (talk) 15:24, 28 February 2018 (UTC)
  • Support Per others. Manelolo (talk) 14:49, 3 March 2018 (UTC)

Promoted File:Ansel Adams and camera.jpg --Armbrust The Homunculus 09:08, 4 March 2018 (UTC)



Freight train SŽ 363-002[edit]

Voting period is over. Please don't add any new votes. Voting period ends on 12 Mar 2018 at 16:39:18 (UTC)

Original – Freight train SŽ 363-002 of Slovenian Railways. "Heavy duty" type of shot
Reason
quality image, working freight train on hot day
Articles in which this image appears
Slovenian Railways
FP category for this image
Wikipedia:Featured pictures/Vehicles/Land
Creator
Petar Milošević
  • Support as nominator – PetarM (talk) 16:39, 2 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Oppose, feels unbalanced and the engine is dark. Daniel Case (talk) 18:46, 2 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Oppose, low EV because of front view - wheel arrangement and rest of train not visible. --Janke | Talk 18:56, 2 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Oppose The angle shows very little of the locomotive. Mattximus (talk) 14:33, 3 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Oppose – Per three previous posts. (Three-quarter oblique views generally are best for such objects.) Sca (talk) 16:14, 3 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Withdraw I like picture very much. But different taste. --PetarM (talk) 11:52, 5 March 2018 (UTC)

Not Promoted --Armbrust The Homunculus 14:42, 6 March 2018 (UTC)

  • Withdrawn nomination. Armbrust The Homunculus 14:42, 6 March 2018 (UTC)



End of World War II in Finland[edit]

Voting period is over. Please don't add any new votes. Voting period ends on 8 Mar 2018 at 21:05:01 (UTC)

Original – Finnish soldiers raise the flag at the three-country cairn between Norway, Sweden and Finland on 27 April 1945 after the end of Lapland War and thus, the end of World War II in Finland.
Reason
Historic and good quality image illustrates the article and event well
Articles in which this image appears
Lapland War, Military history of Finland during World War II
FP category for this image
Wikipedia:Featured pictures/History/World War II
Creator
Colonel Väinö Johannes Oinonen
  • Support as nominator – Manelolo (talk) 21:05, 26 February 2018 (UTC)
  • Comment – Unfortunately, a very unbalanced composition. I would support only if the image would be cropped as seen in the previous low-res uploads (check the image page). Do that crop in hi-res, and I'll support because of the historical significance and the very high EV. --Janke | Talk 07:17, 27 February 2018 (UTC)
    • Did it myself, slightly less drastic crop than previous low-res versions. Support now. --Janke | Talk 07:48, 27 February 2018 (UTC)
      • Thanks Janke! I was pondering of doing it myself too (since it's a lot better composed this way), but with historical photos I'm always a bit wary. Manelolo (talk) 08:42, 27 February 2018 (UTC)
  • Comment – An interesting footnote to the history of WWII, which in Finland was complicated. Not too bad for a 73-year-old B&W, but I'm not sure there's enough readily accessible visual info for TFP. The crop helps some – could be more on left & bottom, maybe even a bit on top. Sca (talk) 15:32, 27 February 2018 (UTC)
    • @Sca: Quite right. I cropped it a bit more from the left and bottom, but let the top stay as it is. Pinging Janke as well if he is ok/has further comments. Manelolo (talk) 16:01, 27 February 2018 (UTC)
      • Quite OK - we seek consensus, right? --Janke | Talk 16:48, 27 February 2018 (UTC)
  • Support – Lookin' good. Sca (talk) 17:14, 27 February 2018 (UTC)
  • Support - Looks fine to me... a few white spots that seem to be damage, but nothing too distracting.  — Chris Woodrich (talk) 04:12, 28 February 2018 (UTC)
  • Support – Bammesk (talk) 02:07, 1 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Info - FYI, just created a full-fleshed article of the flag-raising if anyone wants to read the background and circumstances. Manelolo (talk) 08:21, 2 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Oppose Low qiuality, even for that time, and not much historic. --PetarM (talk) 10:30, 2 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Support, another iconic flag-raising photo with historical import. Daniel Case (talk) 18:47, 2 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Support - Supporting since there's now an article as per Manelolo chsh (talk) 01:09, 7 March 2018 (UTC)

Promoted File:Kolmen valtakunnan rajapyykki 27.4.1945.png --Armbrust The Homunculus 13:39, 9 March 2018 (UTC)



Dust Storm in Texas during Great Depression, 18 April 1935[edit]

Voting period is over. Please don't add any new votes. Voting period ends on 11 Mar 2018 at 17:45:39 (UTC)

Original – The dust-storm which occurred in America (photo is from Texas) on the 18th April 1935, the storm made a hundred thousand people relocate, and some died too.
Reason
It is high resolution, and it is one of the best, interesting and awesome image on Wikipedia. That is why this should be features
Articles in which this image appears
Thirties
FP category for this image
Wikipedia:Featured pictures/History/Others
Creator
NOAA George E. Marsh Album, theb1365, Historic C&GS Collection
  • Support as nominator – Do the Danse Macabre! (Talk) 17:45, 1 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Oppose – Would need a LOT of restoration before qualifying. --Janke | Talk 19:29, 1 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Comment - While an interesting photo, the original is barely used anywhere on en.Wikipedia. It seems that the majority of articles using it are linking to the restored version, which looks bizarre. chsh (talk) 01:10, 7 March 2018 (UTC)

Not Promoted --Armbrust The Homunculus 00:20, 12 March 2018 (UTC)



Louis de Funès[edit]

Voting period is over. Please don't add any new votes. Voting period ends on 18 Mar 2018 at 13:41:43 (UTC)

Original – French actor Louis de Funès, on the set of his movie L'homme orchestre, in 1970.
Reason
Good quality image, nice expression of the subject, best photograph of the subject that the encyclopedia has to offer, took by a professional photographer
Articles in which this image appears
Louis de Funès
FP category for this image
Wikipedia:Featured pictures/People/Entertainment
Creator
Marisa Rastellini
  • Support as nominator – Groupir ! (talk) 13:41, 8 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Oppose – Face of subject shadowed, distracting background. Target article is a stumpb, and was created only today. Sca (talk) 14:59, 8 March 2018 (UTC)
    Article was created in 2003 ?!! - Groupir ! (talk) 16:02, 8 March 2018 (UTC)
    He means that the photo was added to the article today. Usually, an added photo has to be stable in an article for some time before FCP. --Janke | Talk 20:59, 8 March 2018 (UTC)
    This photo is relatively new on Commons, and the cropped version is more used on Wikipedia. - Groupir ! (talk) 22:18, 8 March 2018 (UTC)
    Actually, I was mistaken. My apologies. Sca (talk) 00:42, 9 March 2018 (UTC)
    Target article is a stump (stub)? At almost 2000 words? Surely you jest.  — Chris Woodrich (talk) 01:55, 10 March 2018 (UTC)
Sigh. Something I looked at – I guess L'homme orchestre – was a stub. Sca (talk) 16:42, 10 March 2018 (UTC)

Not Promoted --Armbrust The Homunculus 10:40, 19 March 2018 (UTC)



Portrait of Maddalena Strozzi Doni[edit]

Voting period is over. Please don't add any new votes. Voting period ends on 21 Mar 2018 at 22:15:53 (UTC)

Original – Portrait of Maddalena Strozzi Doni
Reason
One of most beautiful Portrait by Raffaello Sanzio
Articles in which this image appears
Portrait of Maddalena Doni
FP category for this image
Wikipedia:Featured pictures/Artwork/Paintings
Creator
LivioAndronico
  • Support as nominator – LivioAndronico (talk) 22:15, 11 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Comment -- What's with the light streaks from top down - are they in the original, or an effect of the lighting? Is that the shadow of the frame on the right and bottom left? If so, it needs to be removed, or the photo re-shot. If it is intrinsic to the painting, nothing can be done, obviously. A surly looking madonna, for sure - Mona's smile is better... ;-) --Janke | Talk 17:02, 12 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Thanks Janke. Unfortunately it is a painting on a table not on canvas, and the table is not perfectly smooth, it is a bit swollen ... calculating that this painting is from 1509 (!). Those on the left are shadows, I did not want to cut them so as not to cut the painting.Probably inspired by the mona but Raffaello probably saw it only once. Thanks --LivioAndronico (talk) 23:04, 12 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Comment: Image was just added to the article, replacing a different file. Not sure of the colours. (Compare with other images in Commons:Category:Agnolo Doni and Magdalena Strozzi's portrait paintings by Raffaello Sanzio. --Paul_012 (talk) 14:13, 14 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Hi Paul_012, I do not know what i can answer you, this is done with a professional camera unlike the others. These are the colors. Thanks.--LivioAndronico (talk) 18:03, 14 March 2018 (UTC)

Not Promoted --Armbrust The Homunculus 21:39, 22 March 2018 (UTC)



Wat Arun at night[edit]

Voting period is over. Please don't add any new votes. Voting period ends on 24 Mar 2018 at 19:21:41 (UTC)

Original – The prang of Wat Arun, lit against the night sky, seen from across the Chao Phraya River
Reason
Good quality photo of one of Bangkok's most iconic buildings. I like how the lit prang contrast against the night sky. The near-perfect symmetry isn't easily obtained either. (I note that there's a ghost boat to the left, but I don't find it particularly distracting.)
Articles in which this image appears
Wat Arun
FP category for this image
Wikipedia:Featured pictures/Places/Architecture
Creator
User:Preecha.MJ
  • Support as nominator – Paul_012 (talk) 19:21, 14 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Support Looks great. DonFB (talk) 19:49, 14 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Oppose Nice photo, but a daytime image is better for an encyclopaedia. Charlesjsharp (talk) 09:00, 20 March 2018 (UTC)
    • I agree. And I've looked, but it appears lighting conditions don't favour great daytime shots of the temple. The temple is on the west bank of the river, so afternoon shots are inevitably back-lit. Most early morning shots I've seen have the smaller northwest prang in the shadow of the central one, and by the time the sun rises high enough for the shadow to subside the light becomes pretty much too harsh. There are probably a few months where the sun rises at just the right azimuth to create the perfect lighting, but I wouldn't hold my breath. We already have quite a few night FPs of architecture, and Wat Arun is one of those structures that are most picturesque under night lighting. --Paul_012 (talk) 16:22, 20 March 2018 (UTC)

Not Promoted --Armbrust The Homunculus 21:49, 25 March 2018 (UTC)



Roof of the Duomo[edit]

Voting period is over. Please don't add any new votes. Voting period ends on 25 Mar 2018 at 03:26:10 (UTC)

Original – Looking west along the roof of the Duomo
Reason
Captures the symmetry and grandeur of one of the best places to see Milan from
Articles in which this image appears
Milan Cathedral
FP category for this image
Wikipedia:Featured pictures/Places/Architecture
Creator
Daniel Case
  • Support as nominator – Daniel Case (talk) 03:26, 15 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Oppose - The symmetry is interesting, but the people walking around is quite distracting. chsh (talk) 14:53, 15 March 2018 (UTC)
To me the people are part of the story. It's a tourist attraction. People go there. Lots. In this image they are present but not in a way that (I think) distracts the viewer. Daniel Case (talk) 02:29, 16 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Support - Lovely picture with a great view of symmetry that has been well-taken. Goveganplease (talk) 16:14, 15 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Oppose - Sorry for chsh --LivioAndronico (talk) 17:34, 15 March 2018 (UTC)

Not Promoted --Armbrust The Homunculus 21:49, 25 March 2018 (UTC)



Comparison of orbits around Earth[edit]

Voting period is over. Please don't add any new votes. Voting period ends on 26 Mar 2018 at 19:29:24 (UTC)

SVG animation comparing some Earth orbits, radiation belts and Earth to scale.[1] To allow size and statistic comparison, orbits are drawn perpendicular to the image.[2] animation
  1. ^ The Moon's orbit is around 9 times larger than geostationary orbit
  2. ^ Most of the orbits are actually at significant inclination
Reason
very nice svg animation, EV
Articles in which this image appears
GLONASS, Galileo (satellite navigation), Geostationary orbit, Global Positioning System, Low Earth orbit

Medium Earth orbit, Satellite navigation

FP category for this image
Wikipedia:Featured pictures/Space/Understanding
Creator
Cmglee
  • Support as nominator – Nergaal (talk) 19:29, 16 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Uh, could you redo this nomination so we can actually see the file you want to nominate? Daniel Case (talk) 22:08, 16 March 2018 (UTC)
  • OK, thanks. 23:38, 16 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Support – Thanks, Nergaal. I think it has plenty of encyclopedic value, too :-) Please let me know if any changes should be made. Thanks, cmɢʟee⎆τaʟκ 00:55, 17 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Comment - This is tagged as having embedded raster images. Could we get a true SVG?  — Chris Woodrich (talk) 01:38, 17 March 2018 (UTC)
    • I have no idea how "embedding" and "true" work. Nergaal (talk) 10:24, 17 March 2018 (UTC)
      • Embedding uses an image tag with a "data:image/jpeg" etc MIME type and Base64 encoding to include a bitmap within the SVG. If that's truly a problem, I'll update the globe with a polar map. The issue is that the file size will increase, and unless I find an orthographic projection, the globe won't be as accurate as the current one. Cheers, cmɢʟee⎆τaʟκ 23:29, 19 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Comment - Are all these orbits (at least nearly) equatorial? If they are, then I would support but if not (which I suspect), then the image is misleading, and in that case oppose, unless a proper explanation is made in the caption. The little earth as a raster image doesn't bother me. The animation and highlighting is nice, but it works only on the original file. --Janke | Talk 16:58, 17 March 2018 (UTC)
    • (Edit) I noticed the orbit explanation on the file page, but it needs to be in the caption, at least in some form... --Janke | Talk 17:06, 17 March 2018 (UTC)
      • Not sure exactly what to put in to do justice to the image contents. Nergaal (talk) 19:47, 18 March 2018 (UTC)
        • Thanks for the note, Janke. How about To let their sizes be compared and attributes read off the scales, orbits are flattened to appear perpendicular to the image; most of the orbits are actually at significant inclination. ? Cheers, cmɢʟee⎆τaʟκ 00:38, 20 March 2018 (UTC)
          • Yes, but nevertheless, keep the caption as short as possible, and include it on this page, too. Maybe the Earth shouldn't rotate, I feel that it further increases the chance of "equatorial misconception"... ;-) --Janke | Talk 09:54, 20 March 2018 (UTC)
            •  Done (see above). I feel the Earth rotation helps understand GEO, and the second sentence in the caption sufficiently makes it clear that most orbits are inclined. Any thoughts, anyone? cmɢʟee⎆τaʟκ 23:43, 20 March 2018 (UTC)
    • Support now. --Janke | Talk 08:03, 21 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Support Conditional support, provided explanation is added per Janke's concerns. Wow. It's a shame that there's no support for inline SVG, and that the thumbnail appears so ugly, but I don't think there's anything in the FP criteria that discourages such animations. --Paul_012 (talk) 22:39, 18 March 2018 (UTC), 13:54, 26 March 2018 (UTC)
    • I've added a "link" parameter to the thumbnail so that it directly loads the SVG when clicked. The file description page is still accessible via the ⧉-like icon. Cheers, cmɢʟee⎆τaʟκ 23:31, 19 March 2018 (UTC)
      • Dude, you can probably get most of your vectorized diagram FPs. Nergaal (talk) 00:37, 20 March 2018 (UTC)
        • Thanks, Nergaal, kind of you to say that. I feel illustrating is my way of giving back to the community to educate the next generation, and don't really pursue glory. Of course, I'm touched whenever someone like yourself thinks it worthy of recognition! Cheers, cmɢʟee⎆τaʟκ 00:44, 20 March 2018 (UTC)
          • The point (I see) for FPs is that they get featured on the mainpage. If nothing else, some more people will notice your work. Keep up the great work. Nergaal (talk) 02:16, 20 March 2018 (UTC)
            • The caption still needs an explanation about the orbits not being equatorial (see above). OK, I see it's  Done, so no objections anymore... ;-) --Janke | Talk 09:51, 20 March 2018 (UTC)
  • Support – Bammesk (talk) 14:18, 24 March 2018 (UTC)

Promoted File:Comparison satellite navigation orbits.svg --Armbrust The Homunculus 21:48, 26 March 2018 (UTC)

Not Promoted --Armbrust The Homunculus 15:55, 31 March 2018 (UTC)

  • Nomination didn’t reach the necessary quorum for promotion. Armbrust The Homunculus 15:55, 31 March 2018 (UTC)
